description: {"blocks":[{"key":"75em3","text":"This protocol describes the preparation of rNTPs stock solutions for their use on IVT and other molecular reactions.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"9ql7j","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"9khu7","text":"The rNTPs preparation is adapted from a protocol by Berglund Lab (Goers, 2006), it contains instructions to prepare   stock solutions of each ribonucleotide with a final pH of 7-8 each. It is important to consider that each rNTP has a slightly different molar mass, and this value can also vary according to the degree of hydration of the reagent and provider. The molar mass value you should use to determine the resuspension volume must be the one indicated on the flask that contains each rNTP.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":116,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"amhr2","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"dbo32","text":"In our case, we have:","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"8d6c","text":"ATP (583,36 g/mol)","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"177fb","text":"GTP (567,10 g/mol)","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"4s1kk","text":"UTP (550,09 g/mol)","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"d30rp","text":"CTP (527,12 g/mol)","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"2j63h","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"bqebt","text":"The second part of this protocol describes the preparation of an in vitro transcription (IVT) reaction of fluorescent RNA aptamers, like Spinach or Broccoli. In our lab, we use it to test, validate and standardize our buffers, enzymes, ribonucleotides and other reagents. Spinach and Broccoli aptamers bind to DFHBI-1T and this interaction “mimics a GFP fluorophore”, as the reaction product emits a green fluorescence that can be observed in a UV transilluminator. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":65,"length":29}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"fnsp4","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"frvvo","text":"The homemade IVT-aptamer reaction was based on procedures used by the Adamala-Engelhart Laboratory (Heili et al., 2018 \u0026 Aufdembrink et al., 2020), with our own modifications.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"italic","offset":70,"length":7},{"style":"italic","offset":78,"length":21}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"79tp6","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"5vulp","text":"References","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":0,"length":10}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"2m138","text":"- Aufdembrink, L. M., Khan, P., Gaut, N. J., Adamala, K. P., \u0026 Engelhart, A. E. (2020). Highly specific, multiplexed isothermal pathogen detection with fluorescent aptamer readout. Rna, 26(9), 1283-1290.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"3khis","text":"- Goers, E. (2006). Berglund: Making rNTP - OpenWetWare. OpenWetWare. https://openwetware.org/wiki/Berglund:_making_rNTP","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":1,"offset":70,"length":50}],"data":{}},{"key":"8llh6","text":"- Heili, J. M., Gomez-Garcia, J., Gaut, N. J., Cash, B. W., Aufdembrink, L. M., Heffron, B. A., ... \u0026 Engelhart, A. E. (2018). Real-time visualization of in vitro transcription of a fluorescent RNA aptamer: an experiment for the upper-division undergraduate or first-year graduate laboratory.Journal of Chemical Education,95(10), 1867-1871.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"italic","offset":292,"length":29},{"style":"italic","offset":322,"length":2}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"5mg8h","text":"- Paige, J. S., Wu, K. Y., \u0026 Jaffrey, S. R. (2011). RNA mimics of green fluorescent protein. Science (New York, N.Y.), 333(6042), 642–646.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"ec397","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"concentration","mutability":"","data":{"concentration":"100","error_concentration":false,"guid":"FB9644C05B6011ECB5ED83F523075BB0","id":0,"label":"","scientificNotation":false,"unit":28}},"1":{"type":"link","mutability":"","data":{"guid":"5B3B8B625B6011EC96700A58A9FEAC02","url":"https://openwetware.org/wiki/Berglund:_making_rNTP"}}}}

steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"52dok","text":"Determine the mass of rNTPs that is going to be used. In this case,   of each rNTP are recommended.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":68,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"ejnah","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"amount","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"amount":"100","error":false,"guid":"A6BE25305B6011ECB5ED83F523075BB0","id":0,"label":"","scientificNotation":false,"unit":5}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"d3uo9","text":"Calculate the necessary volume to obtain a   solution of each rNTP.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":43,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"8j9jr","text":"","type":"align-justify","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"d22er","text":"We did this by estimating how many mmoles are in 100mg and used that value to estimate the volume for each 100mM solution. In our case, we calculated:","type":"align-justify","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"6e64u","text":"- ATP (583,36 g/mol) --\u003e 1714 uL","type":"align-justify","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"5car7","text":"- GTP (567,10 g/mol) --\u003e 1763 uL","type":"align-justify","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"eisbp","text":"- UTP (550,09 g/mol) --\u003e 1818 uL","type":"align-justify","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"85bfc","text":"- CTP (527,12 g/mol) --\u003e 1898 uL","type":"align-justify","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"7jugi","text":"","type":"align-justify","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"5qedu","text":"If you are using 100 mg of each rNTP, this result should be around  ","type":"align-justify","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":0,"length":68}],"entityRanges":[{"key":1,"offset":67,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"87q10","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"47fap","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"concentration","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"concentration":"100","error_concentration":false,"guid":"A14FEAC05B6011ECB5ED83F523075BB0","id":0,"label":"","scientificNotation":false,"unit":28}},"1":{"type":"amount","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"amount":"1600-2100","error":false,"guid":"9B8C16405B6011ECB5ED83F523075BB0","id":0,"label":"","scientificNotation":false,"unit":1}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"c69ma","text":"Weight   of each rNTP separately in an 1,5 mL Eppendorf tube. Deposit them on ice.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":7,"length":2}],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":7,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"6qj1s","text":"","type":"align-justify","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"g905","text":"We recommend doing this step slowly, as we experienced a lot of static between the reagents and the tube when we were doing this.","type":"align-justify","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"7q7om","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"db4ar","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"amount","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"amount":"100","error":false,"guid":"72963F405B6011ECB5ED83F523075BB0","id":0,"label":"","scientificNotation":false,"unit":5}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"b80bt","text":"Add   of nuclease-free water to each tube. Vortex and deposit them on ice.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":3,"length":2}],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":4,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"cdr0d","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"ctpup","text":"Since you need to adjust the pH of the solution, we recommend adding less water at first than the amount you will actually need so you can have a broad range of volume available for the next step.","type":"align-justify","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"3s2q6","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"amount","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"amount":"1300","error":false,"guid":"75E1C0C05B6011ECB5ED83F523075BB0","id":0,"label":"","scientificNotation":false,"unit":1}}}}
{"blocks":[{"key":"8ddbh","text":"Measure the pH of the solution using a pH strip.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"alb88","text":"Adjust the pH of the solution using NaOH   and HCl 1:1 to range between 7-8","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":41,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"dkdur","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"cbakg","text":"rNTPs solutions are originally very acidic (pH 2-5), so you will probably need to add only base. The HCl solution is only required if you overshoot the pH by adding too much NaOH. We recommend adding the first   of NaOH 1M and from there continue in volumes between  until you get to the pH 7-8 range. Measure the pH each time with a pH strip and have a record of how much volume you are adding to each solution. Be careful to not go over the final volume.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":302,"length":111}],"entityRanges":[{"key":1,"offset":210,"length":1},{"key":2,"offset":265,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"eq1nb","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"concentration","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"concentration":"1","error_concentration":false,"guid":"800C4AC05B6011ECB5ED83F523075BB0","id":0,"label":"","scientificNotation":false,"unit":21}},"1":{"type":"amount","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"amount":"200","error":false,"guid":"C9C595405B6011ECB5ED83F523075BB0","id":0,"label":"","scientificNotation":false,"unit":1}},"2":{"type":"amount","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"amount":"5-20","error":false,"guid":"CDAF79A05B6011ECB5ED83F523075BB0","id":0,"label":"","scientificNotation":false,"unit":1}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"dh9si","text":"If needed, add nuclease-free water up to the final volume of each solution. Vortex each tube.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":0,"length":9}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"19n8o","text":"Aliquot each tube separately, label them and store them at  until use.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":59,"length":1}],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":58,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"49cd","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"temperature","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"error_temperature":false,"guid":"85B2D3405B6011ECB5ED83F523075BB0","id":0,"label":"","scientificNotation":false,"temperature":"-20","unit":10}}}}
